page.title: 06FEERING CHURCH
page.content: Feering church was built at different times.The first bit made was the{Nave} built in 1200 it is held up by stone pillars.The roof has recently been restored and new oak beams have been fitted.All of the woodwork in the church is made of oak, even the door which has been there since 1400. In 1330 the{chapel}and the{chancel were built.The chapel has many antiques including the picture of Christ painted by John Constable.The {porch}has been restored in the same way, it was built 400 years ago.Small Tudor bricks have been cut by hand and copper has been put on the windows to prevent condensation. The{organ}is controlled at one end of the Nave.The pipes go underground to the other end of the Nave and the organ pipes.
